definition: not worth a penny/utterly worthless
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
surname Qian
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
(negative prefix)/not/no
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: They finally found a small gold coin which was almost worthless.
sentences.chinese: 最后找到的是一枚几乎一钱不值的小金币。

sentences.english: The truth is, the man's not worth a hill of beans.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这小我根柢一钱不值。

sentences.english: The government's plan wasrubbished by the opposition parties.
sentences.chinese: 政府的计划被反对党批得一钱不值。

sentences.english: So fiat money is money which is intrinsically worthless.
sentences.chinese: 是以，名义货泉从它的素质来说现实上一钱不值。

sentences.english: The government's plan was rubbished by the opposition parties.
sentences.chinese: 政府的计划被反对党批地一钱不值。

worthless (idiom)/no use whatsoever
without a penny to one's name/penniless/stony-broke
to toss away like a pair of worn-out shoes (idiom)
to be penniless
of little value
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
to look upon as dirt/considered worthless
dirty soil/dung/muck
incoherent (writing or speech)/nonsensical/a load of crap
priceless treasure
to throw away like worn out shoes
to cast pearls before swine (idiom)/not to get proper recognition for one's talents
base/mean/despicable
